Welcome to the Eyes-Free Eyes-Free keyboard tutorial
Welcome to the Eyes-Free Eyes-Free keyboard tutorial.
In this tutorial, you will have the opportunity to learn about and practice using the Eyes-Free keyboard\'s navigation and editing features.
Click the Continue button at the bottom-right of the screen to start the first lesson.
Using the virtual D-pad
When activated, the Eyes-Free keyboard provides a virtual directional pad on the bottom one-third of the screen.
In this area, you can flick one finger up, down, left, or right to simulate directional pad presses.
You can also tap the virtual d-pad area to simulate a center click.
The virtual d-pad has been opened for you below. Use flick and tap gestures to select the button labeled \"First\".

\"First\" button selected. Now flick right to select the button labeled \"Second\".
\"Second\" button selected. Tap once to click the button.
\"Second\" button clicked. Good. If you swipe your finger above the d-pad area, you will hear a a sound to let you know you\'ve traveled too far.
Place your finger in the d-pad area and drag up until you hear a tick.
Keep your finger on the screen and drag back down into the d-pad area until you hear another tick.
You\'re back in the d-pad area. At the corners of this area are, in clockwise order from the top left, buttons for Back, Home, Search, and Menu.
Drag your finger to the bottom-right corner of the d-pad area to find the Search button, then lift your finger to click it.
Good. Practice exploring the screen using flick gestures. When you\'re ready to move on, find and click the \"Continue\" button.
Typing with the keyboard
At any time, you can press and hold the volume up button to cycle from navigating to typing mode.
The editable text area at the top of the screen has been selected for you. Press and hold the volume up button to switch to typing mode.
You\'ve entered hidden mode by pressing volume down. Press it again to cycle to typing mode and continue the tutorial.
Notice how the phone says \"typing\" to announce that the directional pad has changed to a keyboard.
In typing mode, you can slide a finger around the keyboard to find a letter, then lift to type that letter.
Try typing \"hello\" by sliding your finger around the keyboard and lifting your finger to enter keys.
Place your finger on the keyboard and slide up to the top half of the screen to hear what you have typed.
When your finger leaves the keyboard area, you can lift your finger without typing a key. Try lifting your finger now.
When you\'re comfortable typing, use the right flick gesture in the keyboard area to move outside of the text area and continue.
If you press and hold the volume up button again, you can hide the keyboard to show the full screen. Try hiding the keyboard now.
Now press and hold the volume up button again to cycle back around to navigating mode.
The virtual directional pad is now open. Use it to click the \"Continue\" button when you\'re ready to move on.
hello
Navigating with the keyboard
When editing text, you can use left and right flick gestures to move the cursor forward and backward by single characters.
The editable text area at the top of the screen has been filled and activated for you. Try flicking to move forward and backward by character.
The Eyes-Free keyboard also allows you to move by larger units of text. Tap using two fingers to switch to word navigation.
When word navigation is set, flicking left and right will move by words. Try flicking right twice to move two words to the right.
Double-tap using two fingers to go back to character navigation mode.
You\'ve completed the last lesson. When you\'re confident navigating text, find and click the \"Finish\" button.
